text: I have a strategy that in backtesting works slightly better with best price execution turned off.  Is there a way to turn it off when running the strategy live, so that it only applies to that strategy?  I take it there isn't as it's an account-wide setting.  Is the only option to run it in a sub-account with the option turned off?  If so, how do I go about setting one up?

elements.text: I have a strategy that in backtesting works slightly better with best price execution turned off.  Is there a way to turn it off when running the strategy live, so that it only applies to that strategy?  I take it there isn't as it's an account-wide setting.  Is the only option to run it in a sub-account with the option turned off?  If so, how do I go about setting one up?

text: Contact account manager or email bdp who will route you through...altho I think there are some stringent criteria to be elligible (e.g. prospective trading volume)

elements.text: Contact account manager or email bdp who will route you through...altho I think there are some stringent criteria to be elligible (e.g. prospective trading volume)

text: Thanks. Thought there might be some sort of limitation on who can have them. Unfortunately I don't have an account manager.  I'll email bdp to see what they say.

text: Good luck. IMO it should really be a flag that you set on the order which is how it happens on most (financial) exchanges, rather than account-wide setting :face_palm:

elements.text: Good luck. IMO it should really be a flag that you set on the order which is how it happens on most (financial) exchanges, rather than account-wide setting

text: Out of interest, how would you accurately backtest best price execution being turned off? Do you ask for a junk price and simulate getting matched at that junk price?

elements.text: Out of interest, how would you accurately backtest best price execution being turned off? Do you ask for a junk price and simulate getting matched at that junk price?

text: don't match if match price would be better than limit price?

elements.text: don't match if match price would be better than limit price?

text: So with BPE turned off you ask for X and if there is not enough there to match you your bet placement fails? Is it possible that you still get matched at a higher price than you ask for or does disabling this setting mean you either get what you ask for or your bet fails?

text: :ok_hand:
Pretty restrictive though if it is account wide. Can anyone get sub accounts or is it a PC perk?

elements.text: Pretty restrictive though if it is account wide. Can anyone get sub accounts or is it a PC perk?

text: :pray:
BF aren't that keen on giving them out because the GC doesn't like them. It's not a PC perk though.

elements.text: BF aren't that keen on giving them out because the GC doesn't like them. It's not a PC perk though.

text: The concern is that they could be used to provide access to unauthorised customers - underage, banned, foreign etc, so BF want to know you well. If your account is managed then that's easy but if it's not then there are barriers. As I understand it the AMs can't just give them out, they have to go for approval and the AM makes a case for you.

elements.text: The concern is that they could be used to provide access to unauthorised customers - underage, banned, foreign etc, so BF want to know you well. If your account is managed then that's easy but if it's not then there are barriers. As I understand it the AMs can't just give them out, they have to go for approval and the AM makes a case for you.

text: Yeah, it's taken me months to build up account history. Still don't have but soon I've been promised

text:
Agree with the points made by <@UGV299K6H>, You also have to fill in a confirmation statement confirming if you will use the MSA for your own use or whether you will allow others to use it.
In the latter case you have to confirm that you have undertaken what they call CDD (Customer Due Diligence) with photographic/ID evidence etc (like KYC)
Prior to that though, they review your betting pattern and as part of your application, you have to state how you intend to use the account
Ive found it very useful as it suits my style in compare/contrasts strategies. You can up to ten accounts initially and greater than that upon application
I think <@U4H19D1D2>  has the most I know about! :grinning: (your desk must look like the console of the Starship Enterprise!)

Prior to that though, they review your betting pattern and as part of your application, you have to state how you intend to use the account
Ive found it very useful as it suits my style in compare/contrasts strategies. You can up to ten accounts initially and greater than that upon application

text: The person emailing me from bdp hasn't even heard of sub accounts. They suggested that I set up another main account with a different email address, but I would have thought that would have been frowned upon though as it's multi accounting! To be honest, at the stakes I'm currently using, the difference in P/L in absolute terms between having bpe on or off is pretty small, so not much point pursuing it further at the moment.
